example.name: more or less purely verbal
example.text: The volume is a piece of passional special pleading, written with the heat...of a Liberal damning the shortsightedness of politicians from 1782 to 1832.

example.text: Docherty was damned if he would make a fool of himself again the way he had earlier over the laundry truck.
example.arg: if he would make a fool of himself again the way he had earlier over the laundry truck

example.name: almost purely adjectival
example.text: Fight with Sam Schaeffer, fight with the whole damned Bureau.

example.text: One thing was for certain, there was a letter that Juliet Mitchell had written to Sterling Taber and it was damning to her in some way
